definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: If you give free reign to your employees, what might happen?
sentences.chinese: 如果您爲員工提供了自由支配權，會出現什麼情況？

sentences.english: Refactoring will help you win back the command over your code.
sentences.chinese: 重構可以幫助你贏回對代碼的支配權。

sentences.english: The international capitalists dictate and the nation’s sovereignty becomes a sham.
sentences.chinese: 這樣國際資本家擁有支配權，而國家主權淪爲傀儡。

sentences.english: In times of instability, he said, bad people wield power over the weak.
sentences.chinese: 往往就在動盪中，惡人獲得了對弱者的支配權。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
a tax declaration form/a tax return

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
